definition: to replace

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
to assume sb's name and take his place (idiom); to impersonate/to pose under a false name
impersonator/impostor

sentences.english: That would pave the way for newlywed Odom to start in his place.
sentences.chinese: 那就爲新婚燕爾的奧多姆頂替他首發鋪平了道路。

sentences.english: They rang in a player in the game under a false name.
sentences.chinese: 他們偷偷塞進一名運動員冒名頂替參加比賽。

sentences.english: Two dogs for Guo cut prisoners, also to take eight finger blood hacked joe.
sentences.chinese: 二狗頂替郭割擄，同樣就要擔下砍死喬八指的血債。

sentences.english: Mira Wang, to recognize his own daughter to college impostor fact.
sentences.chinese: 王崢嶸承認自己的女兒冒名頂替上大學的事實。

sentences.english: We'll have to find someone to fill in for Francis tonight as he's ill.
sentences.chinese: 費朗西斯病了，我們得找個什麼人今晚頂替他。

sentences.english: Typically, these can masquerade as a conventional mouse or keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 這些可以頂替常規的鼠標或鍵盤。

sentences.english: It was only a question of a trifling substitution of names.
sentences.chinese: 那不過是一件小小的冒名頂替的事罷了。
那他們就都是冒名頂替者了。

sentences.english: The presidential impersonator has not been found.
sentences.chinese: 總統的冒名頂替者尚未被找到。

sentences.english: Don't be fooled by impostors and copycats whose feeds keep getting disabled. This is the only offici…
sentences.chinese: 不要被愚弄的冒名頂替者和抄襲的飼料不斷得到禁用。

sentences.english: Off you go, have a nice life, there's plenty of people to replace you.
sentences.chinese: 再見，祝你愉快，多的是人頂替你。

sentences.english: Remove the likes of the imposter.
And blights with plague the Marriage hearse.
sentences.chinese: 更帶來瘟疫，將靈車頂替了婚牀。

sentences.english: The representative of register.com then sent the imposter a security code that he had to provide.
sentences.chinese: 的人員隨後請冒名頂替者提供所需的安全碼。

sentences.english: But for now, Harrison and Perry and Jared offer a pretty good substitute.
sentences.chinese: 不過眼下，哈里森佩裏賈裏德們頂替得相當不錯。

definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
by-election
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to dismiss/to discharge/to fire
reserve/backup
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
(med.) cerebral concussion
fighting/killing
to mess sth up/to screw up
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
sporting coach/military drill master (in Song times)
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to renew or extend a contract
abbr. for 北愛爾蘭|北爱尔兰[Bei3 Ai4 er3 lan2], Northern Ireland
bodyguard
commander-in-chief (military)/star player (sports)/key figure (in an organization)
